cs.GT, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with game dynamics and distributed systems, which are both topics commonly studied in the field of game theory (cs.GT). The paper also discusses self-stabilization, which is a concept often studied in the field of distributed computing (cs.DC). The analysis of the behavior of the dynamics in a bounded-recall synchronous environment suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-category of distributed systems (cs.DS). The paper also discusses the use of protocols, which is a common topic in the sub-category of social and information networks (cs.SI). Finally, the paper discusses the minimum number of periods of play required for self-stabilization, which suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-category of information theory (cs.IT).
